reason: The DCT argument on [gamma_0, infinity) as stated is incomplete: the dominating function (||delta_AB||_1 + gamma ||1_A tensor delta_B||_1) / [gamma(1+d_A gamma)] is O(1/gamma) as gamma -> infinity, which is NOT integrable on [gamma_0, infinity). The argument implicitly relies on the fact (established in sibling node 1.6.4) that d/dt E_gamma = 0 for gamma > M(t) <= d_A, so the effective integration domain is [gamma_0, d_A] which is compact. On this compact interval, boundedness suffices for DCT. The conclusion is correct but the statement should either (a) explicitly restrict to [gamma_0, d_A] or (b) cite node 1.6.4 for the vanishing tail. This is a presentation gap, not a logical error.
